result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke Douglas Degler

records.addlTxt: Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/25/22 sp)
Sentencing Hearing set for 11/23/22 - insufficient address
Sentencing hearing on November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea Agreement

Defendant Luke Douglas Degler in court, in custody.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Luke Douglas Degler.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim is present via Zoom.
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-44, 22CF-120 and 22CF-271.

8:34 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Jambois states appearances.  

This is on for a plea and sentencing. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
22CF-44: Defendant will enter pleas to both counts. 
22CF-120: Defendant will enter pleas to Count 2 and Count 6. Remaining are dismissed and read in. 
22CF-271: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 6. Remaining are dismissed and read in. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands.

Court questions the parties as to why there is not a presentence investigation (PSI) requested.
Atty Jamobis explains.
Court will be requesting a presentence investigation, even though this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Barkely addresses the Court. 
Discussions continue. 

All parties will go forward with a plea today and the sentencing hearing will be set for another time.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present via Zoom, does not wish to make a statement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF-44: Count 1:Guilty.
22CF-44: Count 2:Guilty.
22CF-120: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-120: Count 6: No Contest.
22CF-271: Count 1: No Contest.
22CF-271: Count 6: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of  22CF-44: Count 1; 22CF-44: Count 2; 22CF-120: Count 2; 22CF-120: Count 6; 22CF-271: Count 1 and 22CF-271: Count 6.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
22CF-120: Count 1, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in. 
22CF-271: Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders a PSI.
To be completed within 45 days. 

Parties are to meet with Judicial Assistant to get a sentencing date. 
Victims can address the Court at the time of the sentencing hearing. 

Victim's mother addresses the Court. Victim sent in a written statement on Tuesday.  This will be considered at the sentencing hearing. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked, remanded until the time of sentencing.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed by Atty Jerod Barkley
filed by the State
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 09/16/22 - insufficient address
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
matter set plea/sent 9/16/22 at 8:30
Waiver of Right to a Preliminary Examination and Order to Bind Over /s/ PB 07/16/22
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Examination and Order to Bind Over filed by Atty Jerod Barkley (sent to Br 3 Judge on 07/15/22 sp)

2:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Luke Douglas Degler appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Luke Douglas Degler. 

Court questions Atty Barkley. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Authorization to Appear and Act filed by Atty Jerod Barkley (sent to TTF on 06/22/22 sp)
filed by Atty Jerod Barkley
filed by Atty Jerod Barkley

Adjustment Number: 22A 044293,
Payable Number: 61462,
Receipt Number: 22R 005882,
Amount: $20.00
Initial Appearance set for June 27, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 2
No direct or indirect contact with R.A. or his residence.

1:20 PM Defendant Luke D Degler appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Taylor Soule in court.
Atty Cassidy calls the case and states appearances. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of 2 counts of felony bail jumping and 3 counts of misdemeanor bail jumping. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $25,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule states objections as to bond as stated on record.
Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
